lines.text: I'm going to ask you a question you're probably not going to give me the truth to. Is your relationship with the Gentleman one of a debt or one of convenience?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's one of convenience. Keeping it short for you, it sure beats pickpocketing in the "streets and being beaten when I'm caught."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I hear that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Interesting. How long have you been working for the Gentleman?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "About eight years."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's a long time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I worked my way up."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Does he feel the same about the Xhorhasian as you do?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "As far as I know, yeah. It's not good for business."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You know, it's not as difficult to rally a society of people against another. It's not too hard to start a war if you really want to.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That's true, but-- I don't know his whole plan, per se, but business works well when things "are predictable. Right? And when there's war involved, things get real unpredictable. Emotions "are high. The amount of armed guard and military gets high. We're forced to skulk in the shadows "until it blows over. Last thing we want is for all this to get any crazier then."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I only have one other thing. I was taken by Dolan's passionate message.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "He doesn't deserve it."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All right. Is some of the business that we can expect going to go against the fair people of this city?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Generally, no. Most of the folks that work with the Gentleman and that we work for are "well-paying because they're well-off. Some of them aren't the most moral, either. We don't do "anything that hurts the folk that don't deserve it. At least from what I know. We don't kill, we "don't murder. We just move and sell and deal in various goods that aren't perfectly legal."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Did Ulog and Dolan know about your involvement with the Gentleman?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right, here's my question. Ulog was in against the High-Richter. That was his motivation. Dolan wanted to get after Lord Sutan for running him out of his practice.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Right."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What did you get out of all this?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, if I have a friend that makes it high in the political chain of the city-- Dolan-- and I "have the ear of the Gentleman, that's a mighty powerful ally to the underworld without that ally "knowing."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Indeed. That's a connection worth the trouble.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You're only in it to be a middleman? No goals or aspirations yourself?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, there's good money in being the middleman, if this works out. To be honest, it "sure beats having to shuffle in the shadows. I work better in public anyway. It's what I do for "the Gentleman now."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. You got a nice face. It's good for presentory purposes.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: "You got a nice face"?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: She does! Look! She's got a good face!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm glad you found a place here. It was good to see you again.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You too. Sorry--"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That was a compliment. Did it not?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: If I can't tell, you didn't--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That was a compliment. All right. Guess we'll see you around.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Stay safe. You know where to find me, or at least ask about me, now. Looks like we're in bed "one way or the other."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I mean--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Leave that one alone.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right. Let's go!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We head downstairs.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. You join up with the rest of the crew. You guys have all gathered again. What would you like to do?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Situationally, it could be a thing--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I think they're talking about the sword.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, we've been talking about the sword.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh yeah, the one that we had for--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Jester has it, doesn't she?

lines.name: TALIESIN, TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Jester, by the way, you seriously-- Your farts have been disgusting tonight. I've been sitting next to you all night , and it's just

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Just (dry puffing).

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That's not me. That is just a gift from the Traveler."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (farting) Her skirt's like, (farting).

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is why you don't miss a game, Laura.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: But she's sick.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (singing) I'm on the couch tonight! (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Jester, why are you smearing feces all over your face?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's wafting over.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Anyway.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Lucien--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We can pass out the sword later, but do you think it's something you could use?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It a dark, graphite-colored blade that's hooked in places and this gradual sharp. It's a longsword, so it's not the beefy thing you're used to.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What does she wield usually?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Greatsword.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Moontouched.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is a hefty blade. What you're used to, this one's a little smaller. It's still helpful, but it's your call.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I really saved up for the sword that I have. I thank you guys for thinking of me, but--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Could you have it as a backup weapon or something?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, you could shoulder that motherfucker.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Could you dual wield?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can use it two-handed, do a d10, but that's up to you. It's not as hefty or as sentimental as the one you have.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'll hold on to it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We'll hold on. We'll see if you want to play around with it, Fjord.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Nott, maybe you could use it. You know, for laughs.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's taller than Nott.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It's taller than Nott?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah. Many things are taller than Nott.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I could use it as a makeshift shelter.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You could do the pole vault.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Interesting stuff there.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: What do you think, Fjord?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, I think it's got some potential. Do you mind if I hold on to it for a bit?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: No, by all means. I think I'm a bit attached to my sword.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can I just clock the tabaxi and see where that satchel with our blood in it is? Did she happen to put it down while she was over?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, it is over her shoulder and by her side.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's a shame

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That's a shame, because I wanted to get it back.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nott, why don't you ask that big ogre by the door what her name is?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Why? Why would I do that?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You have such a way with people.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I do not.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, you knock down the barriers, you get right in. Icebreaker.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: People hate me.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, that's not true at all.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I will go with you, if you want. If you want us to ask this--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: There's no part of this that I want! But if you'd like to go over there, I'll be your second.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: To the ogre?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah. I'd be comfortable talking to that little crazy gnome.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Always good to make friends with the doorman. You got to know this.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That is a fair point.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, we can go talk to the ogre.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Tell him that joke you know.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, sure.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Let's go.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can we go by the bar, though?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This is a people-building exercise.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys entered from this side, around the corner the ogre's right there. The bar's up here, and this is where the Gentleman was.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Going to give the bartender my flask, and say: Could you fill this entire thing up?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yeah, no problem. Boss said it's fine."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He's good, pouring a flask like that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He has practice. It's a little spilled. It's a little messy.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Character choice!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Important note: Laura Bailey has texted in that she hates us all.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We'll go over to the ogre, I guess?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sure. This is easy. We're all going to die.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You approach the ogre?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The ogre, who's standing roughly ten, 11 feet tall.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This is a guy, it is a male ogre?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is a male ogre, wearing patchwork hides and fur over one shoulder, large belly, rippling muscle arms, the maul held in one hand, resting against the chest. Deep, angry jaw that has jowls that swing as it turns its head to look towards you. Both the eyes are dark and beady, with a brown iris you can barely see under the folded brow. As you approach, it (snorts).

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I also grab Jester by the wrist and drag her along, because she makes everyone smile, so I bring her with. Yeah, hello. I am sorry to bother you, but I think that we are loosely connected through work relations now. This is my friend Nott, this is Jester. My name is Caleb Widogast, and we are working for the Gentleman, much like you are. We are going to be here--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What do you call a deer with no eyes? No eye deer! (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Come on.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, that's great.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (confused grunt)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh no.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It didn't work.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Literally rolled an intelligence check to see if he got it. And did not.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You know, we don't want to take up too much of your time, I was just hoping to learn two things. One, what is your name?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Kutha."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I wipe the warm breath off of my face.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Kutha.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And my second question is: do you like working for the Gentleman?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yeah."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (cheering)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What is it? (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: From the darkness, she strikes!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It looks so painful!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What's happening?" (grunting) Clawing at the jaw, trying to pull it down.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I will take that as a yes. I am glad we are doing business with this gentleman.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Good to meet you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (groaning) "You do this?!"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, it wasn't me! I didn't do anything! Let's go!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We should go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This terrible grinning ogre, who seems confused with the facial muscles not functioning.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We go up the stairs and out.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You guys made friends. Good job.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Kuthag? Or Kuth--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Kutha. K-U-T-H-A.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Kutha.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Please stick around; we have a great little video at 826 that I think you want to check out to let you know about the-- It's awesome, a bunch of us went down there and I hope helped--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We had the loveliest time, it was a great day; please check it out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We get to go back again on Saturday to finish up our campaign for those kids, it's going to be exciting. We have our Wyrmwood giveaway, of course, for you folks out there. Those of you who want to come over into Twitch chat to enter, the code for tonight is "gentleman"-- "A", singular, "gentleman"! Gentle

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We've been doing this a few years now.

lines.name: JOEL
lines.text: I think this is our third or fourth time together and I really appreciate the incredible support you've given us over the years, so thank you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, aren't the Critters such an amazing group? We've heard rumors of people coming and stopping by and volunteering, yeah?

lines.name: JOEL
lines.text: Yeah, they're an incredibly generous group, and we've had volunteer orientations a few times a month, and there's always a good ten folks who show up, and when we ask them, "How did you hear about "us?" they talk about your show, and it's been a huge help to us.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh my goodness, that warms my heart so much. I love it. Okay, so give us a little bit of a rundown on what 826 is, and what you guys do for all the amazing kids that come through here.

lines.name: JOEL
lines.text: We want to honor their creativity and give them a space where they can have fun and engage with volunteers who can listen and help guide them in their storytelling and in their writing. We do this after school tutoring, we do night time tutoring and we do workshops. We also do a field trip program, and then we also go into schools all across Los Angeles to provide this free, one-on-one service to kids.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You guys have 826 chapters all over the country, correct?

lines.name: JOEL
lines.text: That's right, we're part of 826 National, which is our umbrella organization out of San Francisco. We have chapters in San Francisco, we have one in New York, in Chicago, D.C., Michigan, Detroit. We're actually opening one in New Orleans very soon.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (gasps) Hey, NOLA!

lines.name: JOEL
lines.text: NOLA. So we're excited. We're all very connected and we share resources and support each other. We're all independent non-profits in our cities, but we collaborate and support each other.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I love it so much. You guys have the Time Travel Mart, which is amazing, if you're ever in Los Angeles, you have to come visit it. You have different themes for each of those across the nation, yeah?

lines.name: JOEL
lines.text: Yeah, so we have actually two Time Travel Marts here in Los Angeles. We've got the one here that we're in Echo Park, and we have one in Mar Vista, which is from the 1890s-- this one's the 1980s Time Travel Mart. San Francisco has a pirate store, New York has a superhero supply store, they sell robot supplies in Michigan.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughs) That all feeds right back into the organization, yeah?

lines.name: JOEL
lines.text: Yeah. All the profit from those sales help pay for the free services we provide to kids from six to 18 years of age.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How did that even come about? How did you guys think to do that? It's so brilliant.

lines.name: JOEL
lines.text: Dave Eggers, one of the founders of the organization, he was working with some volunteers at our founding site in San Francisco, and when they were taking apart the place, somebody said it looked like the inside of a pirate ship. So they decided to build a pirate store in the front. It was a joke at first, but people started leaving money at the counter. They didn't even have a person who would take money-- people kept donating and leaving money, so it became a concept, and all the cities now have storefronts.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Now, if people want to get involved in 826LA or any of the 826's across the country, how is the best way to go about doing that?

lines.name: JOEL
lines.text: Well, you can go to our website 826la.org, and there's a whole section for volunteers where you could learn about what it takes to volunteer and you can sign up for volunteer orientation. All of our chapters across the nation have their own sites, so folks can visit and get involved.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Awesome. You don't necessarily have to tutor if that's not your jam. You can do many things, right?

lines.name: JOEL
lines.text: Yeah, we don't turn any volunteers away. We try to figure out ways to get all volunteers involved. We need help with design, we need help with copy editing, we have a ton of projects that we could always use help on.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Amazing. All skill sets are appreciated.

lines.name: JOEL
lines.text: Absolutely.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Joel, thank you, as always, for taking the time.

lines.name: JOEL
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right, we'll see you soon.

lines.name: JOEL
lines.text: See you soon.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right, here's the deal: we are dedicating the next four weeks to our favorite charity, 826LA. Now, for every 5000 dollars we raise, a new incentive will be unlocked for everyone.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: For a complete list of those incentives, head on over to geekandsundry.com.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Additionally, D&D Beyond has offered to donate $100 for every natural one rolled by the Mighty Nein up until June-- including every natural one rolled to date, making a positive out of our misery.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And we have an amazing community member and Critter who has graciously offered to match all donations up to $40,000. That means each dollar that you donate will be doubled.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So I guess it's time, guys.

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Let's do this! [break]

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Welcome back. Great timing.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: They're getting worse.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With the recent storm mostly passed, it seems at least the gray skies are clinging as hard as they can. What do you wish to do?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sun's on its way down, you said?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The sun has recently set.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It has set, okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I feel like I should divvy up that gold that I didn't hand out earlier.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That is a very fine idea.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, I'll have to remember--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We want to go back to the Leaky Tap?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll have to remember to do that some other day.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think that also sounds like a very fine idea.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You know, that's safe. We should also probably check in on the dodeca-doohickey as well.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's a fair point.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, right. Does Jester have that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Jester has it, yeah, inside the backpack.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, right, she has it. Never mind.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I guess we should let Horris know that he'll get an escort out of town, right?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. He was at the Leaky Tap, right? We left him there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You left him at the Leaky Tap, yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, yeah. Let's do that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Let's do it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you guys head back to the Leaky Tap. You head back to your chambers, and within the one room, Horris has been very careful. As soon as you open the door, Horris immediately grabs the nearby chair and like gets ready. "Oh. You've returned."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Going for the chair. I'm into it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Sorry, just, I'm a little jumpy. How are things going? How's the search been?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It went well. I think we found suitable passage for you out of this city. Needless to say, without involving you too much, we're going to have someone take you out a secret entrance and make sure you're safe on your way out.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I hope you're okay with being blindfolded.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I trust you. Yeah."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sorry. It was part of the deal.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, I guess it was.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Okay. No, that's fine. (sighs) Thank you. I can't even begin to express my thanks."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I didn't write down how much fucking gold, didn't I? 620.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is Dolan gone? Already?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Dolan is staying. Horris is getting out of Dodge.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Got it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Horris, have you heard anything while we've been gone, or have you been staying in here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I've been staying in here. I've been looking out the windows. There's been more guard "activity in the streets. It looks like they're making their way inward into the city and "beginning to inquire, at least from what I've seen. That's it. Other than that, I've just been "bored and reading this book." (chuckles)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Page-turner.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yeah."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Any favorite parts?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Eh, no."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hate those. Pictures good?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "There aren't any pictures."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What the fuck are you reading it for, then?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (clears throat) "Anyway."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (whispers) Your Grog is showing.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, sorry. Listen, everybody gets 104 gold.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: 104 gold?!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yep, and three silver.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: 104 gold.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, not you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Not yet.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (laughs) Fuck off. I was there in spirit.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How many silver? What did you say?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Three silver.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This is a good time to mention that in between last game and this--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: --cantrips not--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can buy cantrip scrolls, but not--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Right, but Caleb would have known that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: After Liam had asked the DM.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct. You cannot transcribe cantrips.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So we're switching out that cantrip for Hold Person, if that was at the store.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right. Yeah, it was. And paid the difference.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And Caleb is flat broke. Until right now!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There you go! Always skirting that edge. I lived

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So did we all.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So much ramen.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It was D&D ramen.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Paycheck, paycheck, paycheck. Paycheck! It's gone.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Cereal for dinner.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Anyway."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well. I assume they'll come for you, sometime in the night or in the morning. Hope you won't mind if we don't wait. We traded your expedited journey out of the city in order for us to go and take care of some bit of business for them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Very well. Just tell me what you need from me, or what I should do."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We didn't really ask, did we?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I thought he was coming with us when we go to leave. That's what I thought.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is that-- or am I mistaken?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, I think that's probably right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You didn't specify. But that seems like it might be a viable plan.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Either that or they'll kill him. (fake laugh)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Out of game, out of game! Don't, you're not-- DM's not here. DM's not here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: DM's always here.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We'll figure it out.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You blindfold him on the way to being blindfolded?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Because if we take him down into the Evening Nip with us then they're going to want to do the whole "Let me take your blood!" thing and "You weren't here," and "Who the fuck are you?" and all that shit.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: True.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: How are we going to get him through the city with a blindfold on?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So we don't want to do that. Sorry, also Marisha talking right now.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Maybe just before we go in. Anything we want to do before we go out on this errand?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, I think there was one thing. Tell us everything about you! Are you fucking kidding me?! Leave! Leave, Horris! Leave!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'll step in one of the other rooms. Is there a key I could--"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Just don't steal any of the pillowcases or go through any of our luggage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, they're booby-trapped.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Okay." He leaves the room. As soon as he leaves the room, Jester goes, "Okay, so tell us "about you! Each!"

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I mean, this is not about me right now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It could be!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It doesn't need to be.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But you have secrets too! And you're a pair! You know, I distinctly remember a moment when we were the shady pair of this group. But now it looks like you guys are!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Somehow, even as individuals, we are all somehow shady pairs. It is just inevitable.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Now I'm hungry for pears.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I mean, Lucien, Noganon, what the fuck?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Lucien sounds very, "I'm trying to find myself," by the way. Just throwing that out there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Angsty teen.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, it's very angsty teen!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is your real name Peter?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I dated a few Luciens. Like, way too many Luciens.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is this Marisha, or is this Beau?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: This is... Beau.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Never mind.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Beau, but it's still not necessarily untrue.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Undetermined percentage is still--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We've all been Lucien.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Six of one, half a dozen of another. Order of the story.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Lot of guys in bands. Yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So. Well, I was born on the continent of-- I really--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, don't stop. Just keep going.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Would you like a drink? Here. It's filled with many alcohols from different taverns.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I genuinely thought I would have some bullshit together by now, and I'm really sort of stuck.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Listen, I've never pushed you to talk about anything. If you don't feel comfortable, you don't owe any of us anything.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's dangerous, though. It's officially dangerous.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What, to tell us what you're about to tell us? For us, or for you?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: At this point, what's the difference?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, one's us and one's you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We definitely left our vials in a shady cellar with a bunch of underground criminals.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm very excited about them. They're empty, but they're still really shiny.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (intones melody)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: They're all the same note because they're all fucking empty. (intones melody) Oh no, that wouldn't work.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But seriously.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: But seriously. I've been part of a shady group. I've been dealing with shady friends for as long as I can remember. If there's one thing I've learned about dealing with people that you can't trust, is that you have to trust them where you can and not trust them where you can't. I'm not saying that I know what I'm doing or anything, but I don't want anybody-- I want this to work. I need this to work. I've not done this in a while. All right.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I noticed that she kind of had the same influence over the blood that you have, but different.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, that's interesting, isn't it? This might even be easier if you just ask questions. I really don't know how to tell this story.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Why do you have so many names?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I woke up without any names, or any past, buried in the ground two years ago.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Buried in the ground?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You woke up buried in the ground?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Were you dead?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Obviously not.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: In a box? In the dirt?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: In the dirt.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And you are saying that you have no memory?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: My first memory, my oldest memory is dirt in my face, underground.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Jester would like to cast Zone of Truth.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Keeping it real on the field line!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She says: (as Jester) I would like to play truth or dare, but without the dare.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: How honest do I have to be?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll find out in a second.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, you can say whatever you want, but whatever you say has to be true. That's how it works. You can also just say, "I don't feel like talking."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Everybody please make charisma saving throw.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Wow.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Saving throw?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Charisma saving throw?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Charisma saving throw.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I got a one.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Hey, money!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Natural one! Ten dollars! To 826LA! (cheering)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's 100 dollars.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What!? That's even better!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: 100 dollars for every natural one.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I rolled a four.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, you're in.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Everyone else, you have to speak the truth.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But, DM, we know that, we feel it, according to the spell.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes. You all sense the energy come over you and for a second you're a little confused by it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's kind of all jumbled. It's what I've been told, about some of it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So is that ritual she was rambling about?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't know.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So before you woke up in the dirt, nothing?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There is no before. Whatever happened before is not me. It's not part of anything-- (sighs)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Like your life reset somehow? Or you just don't remember?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Fuck him. I am enjoying what I'm doing; I want nothing to do with that. Anything that came before, I was happy to just leave it be.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, but do you have any theories for what happened before?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Did you look the same, or did you come back--?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: How would I know?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Everything before two years ago is nothing to you. Black.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's somebody else.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Two years ago, did you have all those tattoos?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, not exactly.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Any of them?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Some of them, yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How much time passed between waking up in a dirt box and the circus?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Days. I was a bit out of it. It's hard to remember. I wasn't speaking, really. Do you have memories from your childhood?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, many.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It felt like that. It's all bright and more meaningful than it should be. There was just nothing. I was practically catatonic; I was barely speaking.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Did you wake up to people, or alone?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Alone.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are you a good guy?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'd like to think so.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Why did she seem like she looked up to you so much?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I've never heard the name Lucien before, or that other name. I've never heard of any of it.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I didn't realize you didn't. You did a good job at pretending.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Who cares where anybody came from?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How do you know she actually thinks it's you and not, you know, maybe she just mistook you for someone actually named Lucien?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's possible except, of course, she had weird blood powers.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So this happens to you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Few months after I came to, I started noticing I could do things, knew things that I didn't necessarily know I knew.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are you talking about your abilities?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah. I can-- can I see that dagger?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I have three of them.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Pick one.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (dink)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Ice.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You watch as this large cluster of moisture all of a sudden solidifies around the outside of the blade, and the blade is now encrusted in jagged ice shards that just stick out, the steam coming off of it. Mist.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's amazing. I would ask about how you discovered that, because that would not be something that I would ever just do, just to just see. But we'll leave that for another day.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh no, I can, we're here. This is happening. That's fine.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Question. Go back two beats. You said, "Who cares about what happened before?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you really not want to know your past? Answer truthfully.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Whatever it was, it doesn't feel good when I-- the moment when something creeps through, I don't like it. I don't want anything to do with it. I was happy! I liked the circus! The circus was great!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (As Jester) "Oh! I have a question! Is there anyone in the group you find super attractive?" (As Liam) A text from Laura.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I think she was asking Yasha.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, ask Yasha, oh.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Too late.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (As Jester) "What about you?"

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As the nature of the spell, you know you are under the effect of it, and you can be dodgy if you need to, but it's up to you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (As Jester) "You can tell me!"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's a good Laura.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I feel like-- it's a very good Laura. Yes, of course there are people here that I think are very attractive and charming, but that doesn't mean I will act on that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You can be monosyllabic if you like with these people.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Molly--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Mm-hmm.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: In the years that have gone by--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yasha has a crush on me.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Has anyone called you any other names besides Molly, Lucien or--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Nonagon?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. Mahna Mahna.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, whatever that was. Not without me feeding it to them first. I mean, I've conned people. We've all conned people. I've used other names before.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, but did they know you? Did they come up and give you a name?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: This was the first time that's happened.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: A lot of this was in the hopes that maybe it would never happen, keep moving, keep quiet.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You don't know anything about the ritual she was talking about?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: But I'll say this, and I'm going to put the knife down. Is there anything sharp around? Anything at all?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: In this group?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, plenty of things that are sharp.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Something that's even ridiculous, like something not normal.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, I mean, there are jagged parts of the wooden frame of the bed.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Perfect! I'm just going to cut myself again on the wooden frame and grab it, and use radiance.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You watch as this bright, vibrant light billows out of it, glowing in the vicinity, similar that you've seen it encase the scimitar.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll admit, this is new.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, that's a hell of a thing.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You got to see the first time this happened.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yasha, how much of this was under wraps? You knew any of this, in your time in the circus with--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I knew that he woke up and that he did not know who he was, but this was the first time that this has happened. Where someone has come to us and recognized him from his past.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (As Jester) "Molly, what about have you ever pooped your pants?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's actually in the text thread chain.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Not that I'm-- Well, no. That's fair, sure. Well, it was worth it every time.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm sorry to belabor this, but what if you had a good life before this? What if you were famous or rich or had friends or family?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I think were quite an amazing person--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm told, although I don't entirely remember this part, that I only said the word empty over and over again for the first week.

lines.name: TRAVIS, MARISHA, SAM
lines.text: Empty?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't know what that means.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: M.T. or empty?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Empty. I don't know. Barely remember.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Jester? I feel your touch on this conversation, is this all accurate?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "As far as I can tell, yes. He did indeed poop his pants."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And the rest?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh that too, yes!"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Empty.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That sounds terrible. I don't want to remember anything. I don't want to anybody else's baggage in my head and I don't want anybody else's problems, thoughts, ideas. I like this person, right now is a good person. Is a fine person. Is a happy person.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: She kept referencing a book.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No idea.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Sounds shifty.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What if we could find the book?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Nope. I don't want it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, I will say, I am a little concerned about, you know, loose ends coming to bite you, and us in the butt. However--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We all have a few, I assume.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I believe in second starts and that's enough for me.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Can you imagine what it would feel like to not feel anything about anything that had happened to you so far?

lines.name: TRAVIS, LIAM, SAM
lines.text: No.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Why am I not surprised?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What do you mean yes? You can imagine what it's like what it's like to not feel anything before this moment? Have you died before?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No. Doesn't mean you have to find meaning in meaningless things.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's very freeing. It's the best thing-- it's the thing that happened to me. It's not the best thing that happened to me, it's the thing that happened to me. I found peace in building a new person. The Moonweaver--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You know just because you know about your past doesn't mean you have to be beholden to it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's true.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: If you--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What if it feels that I owe it something?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You don't owe your past shit. If I don't feel anything about my past, but I still remember it and I still don't give a fuck about where I came from then, why should you care about shit that you don't even remember?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's a layered question.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Never trust the truth. The truth is vicious. The truth thinks you owe it something. None of that. I like my bullshit. It's good. It's happy. It makes other people happy.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But it's not who you are.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It is exactly who I am.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I ask you, when you're praying over your swords at night, are you actually doing anything?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, do you know who the Moonweaver is?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Excellent. The swords are cheap carnival glass. There's nothing special about them.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: May I make a check to see if I have ever heard of the Moonweaver?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a religion check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is the Moonweaver not real?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh yeah, you've definitely heard of the Moonweaver.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Literally a decorated pair of swords to make them look special.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The Moonweaver is classically more of an elven deity. They are a god over night, of shadows, music, there's a lot of variations to what they go over, but they are definitely not one of the approved religions in the empire, and is not considered one of the betrayer gods classically. Is an inspiration for a lot of art in classic elven history, even some modern. The caretaker of evening trysts. Has a lot of unique history to the Moonweaver.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So it's you that's special, not your swords.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's true.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Molly, you seem like you have a pretty solidified identity for someone who has only had consciousness for two years.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Things came back quick, and the circus helped. They were good people. They did a lot of me and joy can fill an awful lot of a person's life.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Things came back quick; do you feel like there's still remnants of whoever you once were that have informed who you are now?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Maybe. I feel tinges of things on occasion, nothing I like.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Interesting.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If you always lie and bullshit, how are we ever going to believe you?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Because I always lie and bullshit.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can kind of agree with that. Cheers to bullshit.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I may be a liar but I'm never a betrayer. I'm honest in my work, and I believe in doing a good turn. I've never cheated you out of money. I've never robbed from you. I stayed with that circus for two years, I know how people treat each other. It's important. And all that stuff you told me before? I've got to admit, I didn't even listen to any bit of it. I was just trying to teach you a lesson. I don't care where you've been. I don't care what terrible things any of you have done. You're here now. This is how it works.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (as Jester) "Molly?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes, darling.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (as Jester) "I have a question."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Of course.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (as Jester) "Can you really read fortunes?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I use fortunes to tell people what I see in them. But sometimes, sometimes, I feel like maybe there's something that tickles the back of my head, I will admit.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (as Jester) "You have a feeling?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Some days.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Don't believe him, Jester.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Am I lying?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He has to be telling the truth.

lines.name: TALIESIN

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is it-- yeah, no. So I show off the peacock a little bit. One of the peacock feathers on the neck--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thank you, Liam. One of the eyes on one of the peacock feathers is a bright crimson red, which any of you if you'd ever made a fucking insight check would know. God, I was waiting for you to fuck with me. It's also the same place that he bleeds every time that he uses any of his powers. There's also a red eye on the snake on the palm, and there's a red eye on the snake on the opposite side of the hand.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't know.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They were just there.

lines.text: You don't have to do every one of these that's she's going to fucking write.

lines.text: I don't.

lines.name: LIAM

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: But now that you bring it up, because I'd never occurred to it, I might start.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, that was for Caleb. Never mind, sorry.

lines.name: SAM

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No. We tried-- That's dangerous work and it'll usually backfire. No interest in that. It's mostly just trying to help people get their shit together. Did someone send you on the wrong path?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's fair. I don't care, to be fair.

lines.name: MARISHA

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes. Everything. I like the safety of it, and if I had had my way, this would've been a conversation for a later date. But I need to protect you and myself from whatever that is, so you need to know that that is a wild card.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I appreciate that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well this was fun.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But I will say this: Lucien?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's a terrible name.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't ever want to know who that person is.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's like a kid with a soft mustache that's not like a real-- you know, like a--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's just a person who had this body. They abandoned it, it's mine now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I think that you need to know where you've been to know where you're going and I respect your feelings--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And I feel that you're fretfully ignorant and filled with platitudes. But I still like you regardless.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I feel like when you're ready to know your past, I would support that and I would help you find it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Maybe he killed goblins. Maybe he was a goblin hunter. Maybe he

lines.text: We have some things to do tomorrow. I am satisfied, Mollymauk Tealeaf. For now.

lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Me too.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You don't have to reciprocate it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm waiting for the spell to dissipate before I say anything.

lines.name: MATT

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I both like you more and less at the same time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The spell's gone.

lines.text: Yes

lines.text: As you force it to apparate once more in your grasp and the blade returns, it has the same hooked shape, but now this blade is encrusted with barnacles along the base of it. Edges of it have curved around and water continues to drip off this. It seems to have transferred whatever the essence of this pact blade is to this one. At this moment you realize whatever weapon you seem to bond with in this way will carry that same aquatic essence based on the communion that you've acquired.

lines.text: All righty. So for those of you who are making your way towards the Pentamarket, you eventually find the outskirts of the Invulnerable Vagrant. You enter the interior and there are two other individuals that are doing business with two of the Pumats.

lines.text: So as you enter the chamber and you see the two Pumats are busy, the counter is currently not helmed and they're mid-discussion, but one of them turns and kind of acknowledges you enter. "Oh, that's real nice to see you. Just relax there a bit. If you need help immediately we can see if Prime's available."

lines.text: Well, if you wouldn't mind, this is one of our compatriots. This is Yasha. New to your establishment.

The curtain opens and you see one of the Pumats, but with a set of goggles right above the head, an apron on with a bunch of different tools and various accoutrements stuffed into different pockets. "Hey, so I'm helping someone. Who needs help?

lines.name: ASHLEY

lines.text: "You can probably go to a blacksmith and get that made for you. I don't really craft things here from their base components. We generally take them and I enchant them to a better degree. I make generally not-so-great things pretty great."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh!

lines.text: I gather we all hear this conversation, yeah?

lines.text: I don't. That's actually-- I wanted to get some. Let's see. Just want to double check to see if I do.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All righty." Comes out. "I've got two vials of holy water remaining. Those will run you about 25 gold pieces apiece if you want them."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Perfect. That's exactly what I was looking for was two vials of holy water.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, look at that. It's like it was meant to be. Straight up destiny."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughs)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Probably need some healing potions or something?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah. Do you have some healing potions?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Ah, well you see, funny thing with all of these adventurers, keep coming in and clearing me out. We got maybe two more, but you got to give us time to restock. You guys, your friends here have been mighty hungry."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh my god, that head shake afterwards.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Her initial regret.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The bail.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Immediate nope. Nah.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: How much are they?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They've been in here a few times." He's like, "All right. Great. Thank you for looking out there, buddy. All right. So--"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm really glad to hear that friendly discount's getting even friendlier. That really nice cloak you have on the wall.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yep?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How much is that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, you're referring to that protection cloak. Let's see here." (grunts) Takes it off the counter, checks it. "That'll run you back about 800 gold pieces."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I think I'll take that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Whoa!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well." You watch the demeanor shift a little bit from like the "I'm busy." Like "Well, happy to see a big spender coming on first thing in the morning." You start seeing more of the connection with the other Pumats.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ah, regular Percival de Rolo over here.

lines.text: "Well, might I have your name? I don't think we've had the pleasure personally."

lines.name: TRAVIS

lines.text: "Fjord--?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Tough.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Fjord Tough. Pumat Sol

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: So does that mean that the-- I've seen a deal somewhere with somebody, also threw in some healing spells when they bought a cloak? Is that a thing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You're looking for a discount for the healing potion?"

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a persuasion check.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: My charisma's fucked.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I know. But, hey, you never know.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I like it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yasha and Caleb in Napoleon Dynamite.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'm kind of a fan of the no-nonsense kind of a lady. So, sure, I'll throw in a ten gold discount on each of those healing potions. So that's 80 gold for you for the two."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'll take them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All righty. Here you go."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Okay."

lines.text: I'm sorry, I have a simple request.

lines.text: "That's all right. Simple requests are always open. What do you need?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: About 100 gold worth of ink for transcribing arcane knowledge.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Some parchment. 100 gold, friend. Thank you very much. Pleasure doing business with you."

lines.name: LIAM

lines.name: LIAM

lines.text: Being a wizard's expensive,

lines.name: LIAM

lines.text: Were there any throwing weapons that you have, even if they're enchanted?

lines.text: "Well, I do have one enchanted dagger, if you're so interested."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Would she like that?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't think she would, actually.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She doesn't like to throw daggers. She only likes to throw--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She might, but it doesn't seem her bag.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What does it do?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well this one, when it's thrown, if it misses, it comes right back to you."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It comes right back to you?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "If it misses."

lines.text: "If you miss with it."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Caleb, did you hear that?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sounds like bullshit to me.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's incredible.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: If you miss with it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a pretty useful thing on occasion."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What about yourself?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, I'm fine. He's already-- they're already making me something.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, but I've seen you throw a dagger or two in your time and you always have to walk out to the tree and pull it out or walk out to the gnoll and pull it out. This way it would come right back to you. Think about it.
